abstract: New York City Council passes bill aimed at limiting future Legionnaires' disease outbreaks; legislation requires building owners to conduct quarterly inspections of cooling towers and provide annual certification that their towers have been inspected, tested, cleaned and disinfected; also requires owners to carry out maintenance plan and to register cooling towers.
lead_paragraph: Under the legislation, building owners must conduct quarterly inspections of cooling towers, which have been pinpointed as the source of the outbreak.

headline.main: New York Council Passes Bill Aimed at Limiting Future Legionnaires’ Outbreaks
headline.print_headline: Council Passes Bill Aimed at Limiting Future Outbreaks
